title: One hundred and forty days under the world
creator_credit: Kell Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
brief_description: Deals with one summer’s work by New Zealand scientists in the Ross Dependency in the Antarctic, and the exploration of some of the last unmapped regions. Shows expeditions designed to gather scientific data on the weather, animal life in the area and shifting ice patterns.
